bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Alvey A. Adee, September 14, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: LegationConsulate-Generalof the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, Sept, 14/95.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. OCT 15 1895 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
LegationConsulate-General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, September 14/95.
Hon. Alvey A. Adee, Acting Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge yours of the 23rd of July No 5 containing enclosures from the Secretary of the Mayor of Minneapolis, dated July 16th/95 Concerning the estate of Mr. J. C. Todd, the court has appointed Mr. A. H. Williams Guardian and he has had the care of the children
more than a year. I have put the matter into his hands. He will correspond with the parties holding the property.
I have the honor to be obediently William H. Heard Min. Res. and Con. General
